author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Lady Braves Lose Road Battle to Grambling State, 82-69
text:
Lady Braves Lose Road Battle to Grambling State, 82-69
The Alcorn State Lady Braves fell 82-69 to Grambling State in a SWAC basketball matchup. A strong performance from Destiny Brown, who scored 17 points, wasn't enough to overcome Grambling's offensive efficiency, as they maintained their lead throughout the game. The Lady Braves' bench contribution was significant, scoring 42 points, while they struggled with turnovers despite forcing 23 from their opponents.
- 17 – Destiny Brown's leading score with 17 points and six rebounds.
- 14 – Kailyn Watkins added 14 points with four three-pointers.
- 42 – Points contributed by Alcorn's bench.
- 23 – Turnovers forced by the Lady Braves, but were outscored 17-12 in points off those turnovers.
Despite a strong start and solid contributions from key players, Alcorn failed to maintain offensive momentum and control the game defensively. Grambling’s ability to capitalize on turnovers and maintain shooting accuracy proved decisive.
State of Play- Alcorn State now holds a 5-14 record and 3-5 in SWAC play.
- The team struggled with consistency in shooting, particularly in the second quarter.
The Lady Braves will face Southern University next, looking to improve their standing in the SWAC with a critical game scheduled for Saturday, February 1.
Bottom LineAlcorn's ability to compete hinges on their defensive strategy and consistency in offensive execution. Improved management of turnovers will be crucial for future games, especially as they look to bounce back against Southern University.
